verses.verse: The word <WH1697> of Yahweh <WH3068> came to me, <WH559> saying,

"Go, <WH1980> and cry <WH7121> in the ears <WH241> of Jerusalem, <WH3389> saying, <WH559> <WH559> 'Thus says Yahweh, <WH3068> "I remember <WH2142> for you the kindness <WH2617> of your youth, <WH5271> the love <WH160> of your weddings; <WH3623> how you went <WH3212> after <WH310> me in the wilderness, <WH4057> in a land <WH776> that was not sown. <WH2232>

Israel <WH3478> was holiness <WH6944> to Yahweh, <WH3068> the first fruits <WH7225> of his increase. <WH8393> All who devour <WH398> him shall be held guilty. <WH816> Evil <WH7451> shall come <WH935> on them, <WH5002>"' says Yahweh. <WH3068>"
Hear <WH8085> the word <WH1697> of Yahweh, <WH3068> O house <WH1004> of Jacob, <WH3290> and all the families <WH4940> of the house <WH1004> of Israel! <WH3478>

Thus says <WH559> Yahweh, <WH3068> "What unrighteousness <WH5766> have your fathers <WH1> found <WH4672> in me, <WH7368> that they have gone far from me, <WH3212> and have walked after <WH310> vanity, <WH1892> and are become vain? <WH1891>

Neither did they say, <WH559> <WH3068> 'Where is Yahweh who brought us up <WH5927> out of the land <WH776> of Egypt, <WH4714> who led <WH3212> us through the wilderness, <WH4057> through a land <WH776> of deserts <WH6160> and of pits, <WH7745> through a land <WH776> of drought <WH6723> and of the shadow of death, <WH6757> through a land <WH776> that none <WH376> passed through, <WH5674> and where no man <WH376> lived? <WH3427>'

I brought <WH935> you into a plentiful <WH3759> land, <WH776> to eat <WH398> its fruit <WH6529> and its goodness; <WH2898> but when you entered, <WH935> you defiled <WH2930> my land, <WH776> and made <WH7760> my heritage <WH5159> an abomination. <WH8441>

The priests <WH3548> didn't <WH559> say, <WH3068> 'Where is Yahweh?' and those who handle <WH8610> the law <WH8451> didn't <WH3045> know me. <WH7462> The rulers also transgressed <WH6586> against me, <WH5030> and the prophets prophesied <WH5012> by Baal, <WH1168> and walked <WH1980> after <WH310> things that do not profit. <WH3276>
"Therefore I will yet contend <WH7378> with you, <WH5002>" says Yahweh, <WH3068> "and I will contend <WH7378> with your children <WH1121>'s children. <WH1121>

For pass over <WH5674> to the islands <WH339> of Kittim, <WH3794> and see; <WH7200> and send <WH7971> to Kedar, <WH6938> and consider <WH995> diligently; <WH3966> and see if there has been such a thing. <WH7200>
Has a nation <WH1471> changed <WH3235> its gods, <WH430> which really are no gods? <WH430> But my people <WH5971> have changed <WH4171> their glory <WH3519> for that which does not profit. <WH3276>
"Be astonished, <WH8074> you heavens, <WH8064> at this, <WH8175> and be horribly afraid. Be very <WH3966> desolate, <WH2717>" says <WH5002> Yahweh. <WH3068>

"For my people <WH5971> have committed <WH6213> two <WH8147> evils: <WH7451> they have forsaken <WH5800> me, <WH4726> the spring of living <WH2416> waters, <WH4325> and cut them out <WH2672> cisterns, <WH877> broken <WH7665> cisterns, <WH877> that can hold <WH3557> no water. <WH4325>
Is Israel <WH3478> a servant? <WH5650> Is he a native-born <WH1004> slave? <WH4069> Why has he become a prey? <WH957>

The young lions <WH3715> have roared <WH7580> at him, <WH5414> and yelled. They have made <WH7896> his land <WH776> waste. <WH8047> His cities <WH5892> are burned <WH3341> up, <WH3427> without inhabitant.
The children <WH1121> also of Memphis <WH5297> and Tahpanhes <WH8471> have broken <WH7462> the crown of your head. <WH6936>
"Haven't <WH6213> you procured this to yourself, <WH5800> in that you have forsaken Yahweh <WH3068> your God, <WH430> when <WH6256> he led <WH3212> you by the way? <WH1870>

Now what have you to do in the way <WH1870> to Egypt, <WH4714> to drink <WH8354> the waters <WH4325> of the Shihor? <WH7883> Or what have you to do in the way <WH1870> to Assyria, <WH804> to drink <WH8354> the waters <WH4325> of the River? <WH5104>

"Your own wickedness <WH7451> shall correct <WH3256> you, <WH4878> and your backsliding shall reprove <WH3198> you. <WH3045> Know therefore and see <WH7200> that it is an evil <WH7451> thing and a bitter, <WH4751> that you have forsaken <WH5800> Yahweh <WH3068> your God, <WH430> and that my fear <WH6345> is not in you, <WH5002>" says the Lord, <WH136> Yahweh <WH3069> of Armies. <WH6635>

"For of old time <WH5769> I have broken <WH7665> your yoke, <WH5923> and burst <WH5423> your bonds; <WH4147> and you said, <WH559> <WH5674> 'I will not serve;' for on every high <WH1364> hill <WH1389> and under every green <WH7488> tree <WH6086> you bowed yourself, <WH6808> playing the prostitute. <WH2181>

Yet I had planted <WH5193> you a noble vine, <WH8321> wholly a right <WH571> seed. <WH2233> How then have you turned <WH2015> into the degenerate branches <WH5494> of a foreign <WH5237> vine to me? <WH1612>

For though you wash <WH3526> yourself with lye, <WH5427> and use much <WH7235> soap, <WH1287> yet your iniquity <WH5771> is marked <WH3799> before <WH6440> me, <WH5002>" says the Lord <WH136> Yahweh. <WH3069>

"How can you say, <WH559> <WH2930> 'I am not defiled. I have not gone <WH1980> after <WH310> the Baals <WH1168>'? See <WH7200> your way <WH1870> in the valley. <WH1516> Know <WH3045> what you have done. <WH6213> You are a swift <WH7031> dromedary <WH1072> traversing <WH8308> her ways; <WH1870>

a wild donkey <WH6501> used <WH3928> to the wilderness, <WH4057> that snuffs up <WH7602> the wind <WH7307> in her desire. <WH185> When she is in heat, <WH8385> who can turn her away? <WH7725> All those who seek <WH1245> her will not weary <WH3286> themselves. <WH2320> In her month, they will find her. <WH4672>

"Withhold <WH4513> your foot <WH7272> from being unshod, <WH3182> and your throat <WH1627> from thirst. <WH6773> But you said, <WH559> <WH2976> 'It is in vain. No, <WH157> for I have loved strangers, <WH2114> and I will go <WH3212> after them. <WH310>'

As the thief <WH1590> is ashamed <WH1322> when he is found, <WH4672> so is the house <WH1004> of Israel <WH3478> ashamed; <WH3001> they, <WH4428> their kings, their princes, <WH8269> and their priests, <WH3548> and their prophets; <WH5030>

who tell <WH559> wood, <WH6086> <WH1> 'You are my father;' and a stone, <WH68> <WH3205> 'You have brought me out:' for they have turned <WH6437> their back <WH6203> to me, <WH6440> and not their face; but in the time <WH6256> of their trouble <WH7451> they will say, <WH559> <WH6965> 'Arise, and save us. <WH3467>'

"But where are your gods <WH430> that you have made <WH6213> for yourselves? <WH6965> Let them arise, if they can save <WH3467> you in the time <WH6256> of your trouble: <WH7451> for according to the number <WH4557> of your cities <WH5892> are your gods, <WH430> Judah. <WH3063>
"Why will you contend <WH7378> with me? <WH6586> You all have transgressed against me, <WH5002>" says Yahweh. <WH3068>

"I have struck <WH5221> your children <WH1121> in vain. <WH7723> They received <WH3947> no correction. <WH4148> Your own sword <WH2719> has devoured <WH398> your prophets, <WH5030> like a destroying <WH7843> lion. <WH738>

Generation, <WH1755> consider <WH7200> the word <WH1697> of Yahweh. <WH3068> Have I been a wilderness <WH4057> to Israel? <WH3478> Or a land <WH776> of thick darkness? <WH3991> Why do my people <WH5971> say, <WH559> <WH7300> 'We have broken loose. We will come to you no more? <WH935>'
"Can a virgin <WH1330> forget <WH7911> her ornaments, <WH5716> or a bride <WH3618> her attire? <WH7196> Yet my people <WH5971> have forgotten <WH7911> me for days <WH3117> without number. <WH4557>
How well you prepare <WH3190> your way <WH1870> to seek <WH1245> love! <WH160> Therefore you have taught <WH3925> even the wicked women <WH7451> your ways. <WH1870>

Also the blood <WH1818> of the souls <WH5315> of the innocent <WH5355> poor <WH34> is found <WH4672> in your skirts. <WH3671> You did not find <WH4672> them breaking in; <WH4290> but it is because of all these things.
"Yet you said, <WH559> <WH5352> 'I am innocent. Surely his anger <WH639> has turned <WH7725> away from me. <WH8199>' "Behold, I will judge you, <WH559> because you say, <WH2398> 'I have not sinned.'
Why do you go about <WH235> so much <WH3966> to change <WH8138> your way? <WH1870> You will be ashamed <WH954> of Egypt <WH4714> also, <WH954> as you were ashamed of Assyria. <WH804>

From there also you shall go forth, <WH3318> with your hands <WH3027> on your head; <WH7218> for Yahweh <WH3068> has rejected <WH3988> those in whom you trust, <WH4009> and you shall not prosper with them. <WH6743>
